translation: O mighty-armed Arjuna, according to the Vedānta there are five causes for the accomplishment of all action. Now learn of these from Me.
purport: A question may be raised that since any activity performed must have some reaction, how is it that the person in Kṛṣṇa consciousness does not suffer or enjoy the reactions of work? The Lord is citing
philosophy to show how this is possible. He says that there are five causes for all activities, and for success in all activity one should consider these five causes.
